newsitem.title: GERMANY: German police detain nine for attack on Turks.
newsitem.headline: German police detain nine for attack on Turks.

text.p: German police on Sunday said they had detained nine men after a gang of right-wing extremists attacked four Turkish men at a motorway service station in the eastern state of Thuringia on Friday night.

Police said the nine were part of a group of 45 right-wingers travelling in a coach to a rock concert in Hungary. Police said they had stopped the bus and prevented the men from continuing their journey.
In a separate incident, police in the eastern town of Oranienburg reported they had detained a man in connection with an attack on a man of dark complexion at a soccer match.

Commentators fear that soaring unemployment is leading to a new wave of racist violence in Germany like that seen after unification in 1990, when there was a spate of attacks particularly in the former communist east.
